answers.answer: Dear Amalgam,I can understand your concern.Abdominal bloating and flatulence can arise due to:1) Lactose intolerence – One’s ability to digest milk goes down as one ages and an undigested milk sugar, lactose gets fermented in colon to produce flatulence. This is the commonest cause of abdominal bloating and a trial of a milk free diet for 2 weeks may help to confirm it.2) Conditions which cause intestinal dysmotility (abnormal movement of the intestines) and secondary bacterial overgrowth like hypothyroidism, diabetes mellitus and diverticulosis. This leads to malabsorption of sugars and proteins which are then fermented in the colon to produces "gas". Doing a thyroid profile and a sugar profile will help rule out these conditions.3) Intestinal disorders like celiac disease and Crohn's disease which lead to malabsorption. These are associated with significant weight loss and other symptoms like loose stool or diarrhoea.Please do not hesitate in consulting and explaining your problems to your doctor. They will understand and will help you out.Hope that this information helps and hope that you will get better soon.Thank you for using MedHelp's "Ask an Expert" Service, where we feature some of world's renowned medical experts in their fields. Millions have benefitted from our service to get personalized advice for them and for their loved ones.Best Regards,Dr. Poorna Chandra.
